You are the son of my own daughter Y. Anita and I want you to be my own grandson. I, your grandson, have the good intention of acquiring some property in your name out of love and affection, and I do not want any reward from you, considering that love is gratuitous, and I have given you the property described below, which was acquired by my father and inherited by me by inheritance and has been granted a certificate in my name as C.No.590/2025 by the Tahsildar of V.Kota Mandal, and I have therefore fully acquired the property, which is in my possession, for a sum of Rs.1,10,000/
(One lakh ten thousand rupees in words) as per the schedule, free of charge, and I have given it to you today with all the rights I have. From this
You shall pay the Panchayat taxes etc. that may accrue to you and your heirs, and shall be entitled to donation, sale, exchange, and transfer, with all rights of happiness in perpetuity

You are hereby informed that from this date onwards, you shall have full rights and liabilities in respect of the vacant land as per Schedule. Neither I nor my heirs or others shall have any right whatsoever in respect of the vacant land as per Schedule.
I have no objection to the transfer of the vacant land as per Schedule in your name in the records of the Panchayat. This is a settlement deed of the vacant land as per my consent.

Declaration
I/We hereby declare that I/We have duly ascertained the full facts and circumstances of the case and the value of the property and the stamp duty payable on the said deed under section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899.
I/We hereby declare that if I/We fail to act as provided in section 27 above, the Government may recover from me/us the said amount by levying stamp duty and by paying penalty and interest under sections 64 and 64-A and by prosecuting me/us under section 70.
I/We hereby declare that the property described in this document is my/our sole property and that I have not previously transferred the said property to any other person and that I have not contravened the provisions of section 22T of the Registration Act, 1908 and that if I am found to have contravened the provisions of section 82 of the Registration Act, 1908, I/We shall be liable to the punishment prescribed in section 82 of the Registration Act, 1908. Both parties have read this document. The clerk
has read and heard the document and is satisfied that it is correct. It is filed with our permission. For this, the document is deposited in the State Bank of India, Palamaneru
on the date of the document, minus the stamp, registration fee, user charge, total. 2612-2025.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 9684 of 2025, dated 26/Dec/2025, executed by B. kalyani in favour of Her Grand Son, K. Kiran, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 110 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 822/2, situated in Mudaramdoddi Village and Grama Panchayath, Z.P. Venkatagirikota Mandal, within the District of Chittoor, registered at sub-registrar office Palamaner (1006) is bounded as follows: North by: 10 Feet's Road South by: Open Site of Venu Naidu East by: House of Anitha West by: Road.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
